Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.logger

Class MLogger

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.logger.MLogger
public final class MLogger
extends Object
Custom logging class which uses the Java Logging API for writing messages to a log file. All methods of this class can be called in a static way, using the getInstance method. When calling the getInstance method the fist time at application runtime, a new instance of the MLogger class will be created by itself. This instance is accessible during runtime of the application by any other class. To initialize a new instance of MLogger, just call the following methods, before writing the first log message: 
 MLogger.getInstance().setLogFile("[Name of the Log file]");
 MLogger.getInstance().setTraceLevel([0, 1, 2 or 3]);
and then write a log message, like shown in the following sample:

 MLogger.getInstance().setLogFile("logs/Application.log");
 MLogger.getInstance().setTraceLevel(3); // Log all messages (Error, Warning and Information)
 MLogger.getInstance().log(Level.SEVERE, "The mesh trace string has the wrong format! ", FileUtil.class.getSimpleName(), "createResultsFileName");
This will produce the output:

Sep. 21, 2018 4:36:39 NACHM. FileUtil createResultsFileName
SCHWERWIEGEND: The mesh trace string has the wrong format!

When no logFile and traceLevel is set, the instance will be initialized with the default values:
 logFile = ./logs/Application.log 
 traceLevel = Level.SEVERE

  • Method Details

    • printExceptions

      public void printExceptions​(boolean print)
      Turn on or off printing exceptions.
      Parameters:
      print - true to print exceptions, false to ignore the trace.

    • getInstance

      public static MLogger getInstance()
      When calling this method the fist time, a new instance of the MLogger class will be created and returned to the caller. For every further call, the already created instance will be returned. This construct allows access to all methods and properties of an instance of the MLogger class from any other class during runtime of an application. The usage of the methods is like it is in a static way, but with an instantiated class.

      e.g.:
      MLogger.getInstance().log(Level.SEVERE, "Message", "mainClassName", "thisClassName", "thisMethod");
      Returns:
      an instance of this class

    • log

      public boolean log​(String message)
      This log method writes a short description into the log file.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to log.
      Returns:
      False if the committed string is null (no logging) or the the log method with four parameter.
      See Also:
      Level, Exception

    • log

      public boolean log​(Level level, Exception e)
      This log method writes a short description and the complete stack trace of an exception into the log file.
      Parameters:
      level - The logging level of type java.util.logging.Level
      e - The object of the exception that will be logged like IOException, FileNotFoundException etc.
      Returns:
      A flag to indicate whether the logging was successful or not.
      See Also:
      Level, Exception

    • log

      public boolean log​(Level level, String message)
      Log a message with a configurable level.
      Parameters:
      level - One of the trace level of Level
      message - The message to report
      Returns:
      Call log(Level level, Exception e, String methodName)

    • log

      public boolean log​(Level level, Exception e, String methodName)
      This log method writes a short description and the complete stack trace of an exception into the log file.
      Parameters:
      level - The logging level of type java.util.logging.Level
      e - The object of the exception that will be logged like IOException, FileNotFoundException etc.
      methodName - The name of the method that issued the logging request
      Returns:
      A flag to indicate whether the logging was successful or not.
      See Also:
      Level, Exception

    • log

      public boolean log​(Level level, String message, String className, String methodName)
      This log method writes a short description to a log file.
      Parameters:
      level - The logging level of type java.util.logging.Level
      message - The information message
      className - The name of the class that issued the logging request
      methodName - The name of the method that issued the logging request
      Returns:
      A flag to indicate whether the logging was successful or not.
      See Also:
      Level, Exception

    • log

      public boolean log​(Level level, String message, String mainName, String className, String methodName)
      This method writes a message, specifying the main class, the source class and the calling method into the log file.
      Parameters:
      level - The log level of java.util.logging.Logger
      message - The message that will be written to the log file
      mainName - The Main class of the application
      className - The name of the class that issued the logging request
      methodName - The name of the method that issued the logging request
      Returns:
      A flag to indicate whether the logging was successful or not.
      See Also:
      Level

    • getLogFile

      public String getLogFile()
      Get the name of the log file, to which MLogger will write messages.
      Returns:
      A string with the name of the log file

    • setLogFile

      public void setLogFile​(String lf)
      Sets the name of the log file, to which MLogger will write messages.
      Parameters:
      lf - A string with the name of the log file

    • getLogSizeLimit

      public long getLogSizeLimit()
      Get the maximum size in KB (kilobyte). If the LogSizeLimit is exceeded, MLogger will rename the log file by adding the current date to the name and create a new log file. The archived log files will automatically be deleted, when the keeping age has been exceeded.
      Returns:
      an long value with the file size in KB

    • setLogSizeLimit

      public void setLogSizeLimit​(long lsLimit)
      Sets the maximum size in KB (kilobyte). If the LogSizeLimit is exceeded, MLogger will rename the log file by adding the current date to the name and create a new log file. The archived log files will automatically be deleted, when the keeping age has been exceeded.
      Parameters:
      lsLimit - An long value with the file size in KB. Maximum is 1 GB.
      See Also:
      getLogSizeLimit(), getLogKeepAge(), setLogKeepAge(int)

    • getLogKeepAge

      public int getLogKeepAge()
      Get the number of days, how long archived log files will be stored. I an archived log file has exceeded the defined age, it will be deleted. This logic does only work for log files that have the standard date and time prefix in their name and for log files, that are stored in the defined logPath.
      Returns:
      an integer value with the number of days

    • setLogKeepAge

      public void setLogKeepAge​(int lka)
      Sets the number of days, how long archived log files will be stored. I an archived log file has exceeded the defined age, it will be deleted. This logic does only work for log files that have the standard date and time prefix in their name and for log files, that are stored in the defined logPath.
      Parameters:
      lka - - an integer value with the number of days

    • getTraceLevel

      public Level getTraceLevel()
      Get the value of the traceLevel property.
      Returns:
      the value of traceLevel property of type Level
      See Also:
      Level

    • setTraceLevel

      public void setTraceLevel​(Level lv)
      Sets the traceLevel property with a value of type Level.
      Parameters:
      lv - a value of type Level e.g. Level.SEVERE
      See Also:
      Level

    • setTraceLevel

      public void setTraceLevel​(int lv)
      Sets the traceLevel property with a value of type Level that corresponds to the specified input parameter of type integer. The following integer values are valid: 
       0 = Level.OFF
 1 = Level.SEVERE
 2 = Level. WARNING
 3 = Level.INFO
      Parameters:
      lv - An integer value between 0, 1, 2 and 3.
      See Also:
      Level, setTraceLevel(Level)
